name: Throne
description: An ostentatious throne stands on a dais, with a crown on the seat and a ceremonial sword leaning against one armrest. This card represents the authority of worldly rulers.

person.upright: A person who enjoys exercising authority over others and expects to be obeyed.
person.reverse: A person who resents authority imposed on them.

creatureTrap.upright: A creature that leads others of its kind; alternatively, one with magical powers of influence or command.
creatureTrap.reverse: A creature that unwillingly serves another.

place.upright: A place of authority, such as a palace or a mayor's office.
place.reverse: A place at the edge of a ruler's authority or on the border between rival nations.

treasure.upright: A ruler's regalia, or a magic item (such as a Rod of Rulership) that imparts magical authority.
treasure.reverse: An art object created as an act of resistance to tyranny, or a magic item that protects against restraint (such as a Ring of Free Action).

situation.upright: A contest over who rightfully holds authority.
situation.reverse: A group of people rebelling against a ruler or an authority figure.
